neochain package¶

neochain.nc_community_handler module¶

find_communities(input_file=None, delimiter=None, weighted=None, algorithm=None, **kwargs)¶

This function finds community structure using defined algorithm

Parameters:
  • input_file – (string) Input dataset for community detection, default [.txt]
  • delimiter – (string) Column separator for input file, default [whitespace]
  • weighted – (boolean) yes/no. Is the input file has a weight column?, default [no]
  • algorithm – (string) Community detection algorithm, default [infomap]
Returns:

(dict) Python dictionary of nodes and communities
find_relative_overlap(communities_t=None, communities_t1=None, similarity_measure=None)¶

This function calculates relative overlap of communities

Parameters:
  • communities_t – (python dict) Top ‘n’ communities at time ‘t’
  • communities_t1 – (python dict) Top ‘n’ communities at time ‘t+1’
  • similarity_measure – Similarity measure to use.
Returns:

(python list) list of similar pairs of community id with similarity
find_top_n_communities(all_communities=None, n=None)¶

This function finds the top ‘n’ communities from a python dictionary of nodes and communities

Parameters:
  • all_communities – (dict) A python dictionary of nodes and communities
  • n – (int) number of top community to be selected
Returns:

(dict) of top ‘n’ communities

neochain.nc_graph_handler module¶

find_sub_graph(input_file=None, weighted=None, delimiter=None, top_n_communities_t=None)¶

This function creates a subset of links/edges from the input file depending on the nodes from top ‘n’ communities

Parameters:
  • input_file – (string) A file path to input data at time ‘t’
  • delimiter – (string) Column separator in both input files, default [whitespace]
  • weighted – (boolean) yes/no, if files have weight column or not
  • top_n_communities_t – (list) List of communities containing the member nodes
Returns:

(pandas data frame) a data frame of edges that contains all the nodes from top ‘n’ communities
generate_merged_graph(input_dataset_t=None, input_dataset_t1=None, delimiter=None, weighted=None, top_n_communities=None)¶

This function creates a merged graph data from sub-graph at time ‘t’ and a graph snapshot from time ‘t+1”

Parameters:
  • input_dataset_t – (string) A file path to input data at time ‘t’
  • input_dataset_t1 – (string) A file path to input data at time ‘t+1’
  • delimiter – (string) Column separator in both input files, default [whitespace]
  • weighted – (boolean) yes/no, if files have weight column or not
  • top_n_communities – (list) List of communities containing the member nodes
Returns:

(pandas data frame) A data frame with links form sub graph at time ‘t’ and links from graph at time ‘t+1’
